dynGuiComponents.name: android.widget.TextView
dynGuiComponents.text: To ensure the security of your accounts this app only stores them in encrypted data files using one of the following two methods:

dynGuiComponents.name: android.widget.TextView
dynGuiComponents.text: The KeyStore is a system component of Android for securely storing cryptographic keys. The advantage of this approach is that the keys are stored separated from the data files and can be backed by hardware cryptography (if the hardware supports it). However as the keys are not stored with the apps data this method prevents external backup solutions (like Titanium) from working. If you choose this method you will have to rely on the internal backup functions provided by andOTP.

dynGuiComponents.name: android.widget.TextView
dynGuiComponents.text: This method will encrypt your data with a key generated from a password or PIN. The main advantage here is that this will work with external backup solutions (like Titanium). However you will have to enter your credentials every time you start andOTP.

dynGuiComponents.name: android.widget.TextView
dynGuiComponents.text: By default the Android KeyStore will be used, however this is known to cause problems on certain custom ROMs (and a few stock ones as well). You can change the encryption in the Settings by clicking on the button below.
